response.answer_text: We have lots, of course. We are not as strong or as fast as numbers of other critters… And we can’t fly or live underwater. Our senses are for the most part limited compared to those of other critters as well. We are only comfortable living in a very limited range of temperatures. Of course, we use our much-superior brains to invent technologies that overcome most all those things. Among the more serious limitations is the fact that our rather primitive emotions and survival instincts can overcome that marvelous brain, and lead us into all manner of behavior that is destructive not only to ourselves…. But others as well.

It depends on the individual and my factors such as: Mindset Medical condition Experience Amount of access to Emotional support Level of confidence Situation Capability of endurance Emotional strength
